title: DOE Pulls Plug on Chinese-Owned Company’s Grant Application Months After Alarm Raised
description: A worker’s reflection on a mirror framing a lithium ion battery production line at a plant in Huzhou, China, owned by Microvast Holdings, whose Texas-based subsidiary qualified to negotiate for a $200 million U.S. Department of Energy grant to build lithium batteries in the United States. (Stringer/Reuters)
